name: Open-AutoGLM
description: An Open Phone Agent Model & Framework. Unlocking the AI Phone for Everyone
readme_summary: Open-AutoGLM is a framework for building AI-powered phone agents that can understand and interact with a mobile device's screen. It uses visual language models and intelligent planning to automate tasks described in natural language, controlling the device via ADB.
key_features: Automated task completion via natural language commands
Visual language model for screen perception
primary_use_case: To enable users to control their mobile phones using natural language commands, automating complex tasks and interactions through an AI agent.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, friendly robot hand gently holding a smartphone. The phone screen displays a vibrant, abstract representation of a user's natural language command, such as 'Find the best local restaurant'. From the phone, glowing streams of data flow outwards, transforming into icons of various apps (like maps, social media, and search engines) and then coalescing into a clear, actionable path or map on a stylized digital interface. Subtle code snippets and UI elements are visible in the background, hinting at the underlying technology. The overall mood is helpful and empowering, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The repository name 'Open-AutoGLM' is subtly integrated into the design, perhaps on a small digital tag or screen element. 3D isometric illustration style.

name: Paper2Slides
description: "Paper2Slides: From Paper to Presentation in One Click"
readme_summary: Paper2Slides is a Python-based tool that automates the creation of presentation slides and posters from research papers and documents. It leverages RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) to accurately extract key information, supports a wide range of file formats, and offers customizable styling options.
key_features: Universal Document Support (PDF, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Markdown)
Customizable Styling (built-in themes and natural language descriptions)
Professional-Grade Visuals for Slides and Posters
primary_use_case: Automating the conversion of research papers and documents into professional presentation slides and posters.
cover_image_prompt: A magical librarian character is rapidly transforming a thick, complex research paper into a series of clean, visually appealing presentation slides that float elegantly into a digital projector screen. The librarian uses a glowing stylus, with data particles flowing from the paper to the slides. Subtle UI elements showing document analysis and slide previews are visible on a nearby holographic display. The background is a modern, minimalist study. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a bright, clean color palette and soft lighting, emphasizing efficiency and clarity.

name: PandocX
readme_summary: PandocX is a desktop application built with Tauri and TypeScript that acts as a file converter. It leverages the power of Pandoc to convert documents between various formats, offering the convenience of automatic Pandoc installation and cross-platform compatibility.
key_features: Convert files between any Pandoc-supported formats
Automatically download Pandoc if it's not installed
primary_use_case: Desktop file conversion utility leveraging Pandoc.
cover_image_prompt: A magical alchemist's workbench where various raw materials like scrolls, digital documents, and books are being fed into a central, glowing transmutation device. The device, subtly branded with 'PandocX', is shown actively transforming these inputs into a stream of diverse, polished outputs such as sleek e-books, neatly formatted documents, and presentation slides. Small, ethereal data streams and subtle UI elements hover around the workbench, hinting at the underlying software. The scene is set in a cozy, well-lit workshop with a touch of modern technology. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, inviting aesthetic and vibrant colors, emphasizing the ease and versatility of file conversion.

name: timelinize
description: Store your data from all your accounts and devices in a single cohesive timeline on your own computer
readme_summary: Timelinize is a self-hosted application that consolidates data from various accounts and devices into a single, cohesive personal timeline. It allows users to import and organize photos, videos, messages, location history, social media content, and more, providing a comprehensive view of their digital life stored securely on their own computer.
key_features: Data import from various sources (computer, phone, online accounts, apps, etc.)
Consolidation into a single cohesive timeline
Organization of photos, videos, chats, messages, location history, social media content, contacts
Self-hosted for data ownership and privacy
3D map view with historical path visualization
Ability to display non-geolocated data on maps
Custom file picker for data import
primary_use_case: To create a personal, self-hosted digital archive and timeline of all user data, enabling comprehensive organization and recall of memories and digital interactions.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old archivist sitting at a grand wooden desk, meticulously organizing countless glowing threads of light that represent different types of personal data (photos, messages, locations). Each thread originates from various sources depicted as small, stylized icons (a phone, a cloud, a computer) and converges into a single, beautifully woven tapestry of a timeline stretching across the desk. Subtle digital particles and faint UI elements of the Timelinize interface are visible on the desk. The scene is bathed in warm, nostalgic light, emphasizing the preservation of memories. The style should be a detailed 3D isometric illustration with a rich, warm color palette.

name: devpush
description: Like Vercel, but open source and for all languages.
readme_summary: Devpush is an open-source, self-hostable alternative to Vercel and similar platforms, enabling developers to build and deploy applications across various languages with features like zero-downtime updates, real-time logs, and team management.
primary_use_case: Self-hosting and deploying web applications from Git repositories, similar to Vercel but with more control and flexibility.
cover_image_prompt: A bustling, futuristic workshop where a skilled artisan is assembling intricate clockwork devices. Each device represents a different programming language (e.g., a Python snake coil, a Node.js circuit board, a PHP script). The artisan is shown taking raw blueprints (representing Git commits) and seamlessly integrating them into the clockwork mechanisms, which then light up and begin functioning perfectly with zero downtime. Small, glowing data streams flow from the blueprints to the devices. The workshop is clean and organized, with subtle UI elements displaying build logs and deployment status on floating screens. The overall mood is one of efficient creation and reliable operation. 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant, clean colors and subtle technological accents.
